title: Gulf Islands National Seashore: Permits & Reservations
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Permits & Reservations               Permits & Reservations        Permits The National Park Service requires permits for activities not normally associated with visiting the National Seashore.  For more information about activities requiring permits and how to apply visit see the options below.  If you have additional questions or need assistance, contact the permits office by phone at (850) 934-2605 or by email. - Special Use Permits: Activities such as weddings, sporting events, public assemblies, religious ceremonies, and commercial filming and photography. - Research Permits: Research and collection activities within Gulf Islands National Seashore are managed to prevent damage to the resources, to coordinate research activities, and to assist in the application of science to the management of the Seashore. - Scattering Cremated Remains: With limitations, the National Park Service normally grants permission to those wishing to scatter cremated remains within the boundary of Gulf Islands National Seashore. - Waterfowl Hunting Permits: Between September and February each year, in accordance with State and Federal Regulations, Waterfowl Hunting is permitted within the boundary of Gulf Islands National Seashore. Reservations Picnic Pavilions as well as individual and group campsites at Gulf Islands National Seashore may be reserved by following the links below. - Picnic Pavilions: Several picnic pavilions in Florida and Mississippi may be reserved in advance by the public.  Call the park's Permits Office for more information at (850) 934-2605 or send us an email. - Fort Pickens Campground: 200 sites located at on the Western tip of Santa Rosa Island near the historic Fort Pickens.  Visit Recreation.gov or call 1-877-444-6777 to reserve your site today. - Davis Bayou Campground: 50 sites located near the William M. Colmer Visitor Center in Davis Bayou.  Visit Recreation.gov or call 1-877-444-6777 to reserve your site today. - Naval Live Oaks Youth Group Campsite: This area is reservable throughout the year for organized youth groups comprised primarily of young people under the age of 18.
